rComments: kregg is honestly the best teacher i have ever had. it was a difficult course especially the amount of readinds and difficulty level of the readings but he prepares you for everything! weekly reading reports are extremely helpful for people like me who easily fall behind and he is always there to help. cheap coursepack and wonderful teacher!!

One of the best profs at Dalhousie. Classes are interesting, motivating and hilarious. He's highly approachable, accommodating and respectful. Although he expects a lot, he gives a ton in return. I highly recommend this class or Kregg as a professor in general.

I took the 2100 course and loved it so much I took this one just because i love the way he teaches. The readings can be super intense and hard, but totally worth it. He's truly brilliant and easy going,discussions are awesome...you just have to be committed to the class. Requires some serious effort for a good mark though.

I took the 2100 course and loved it so much I took this one just because i love the way he teaches. The readings can be super intense and hard, but totally worth it. He's truly brilliant and easy going,discussions are awesome...you just have to be committed to the class. Requires some serious effort for a good mark though.

The readings are ridiculous. So unnecessarily difficult for what we are learning. There is no actual text book, just long articles that we are to read each week.  Nothing seems to flow (could be because we are reading about something different each week in the articles).
Fantastic professor. Very clear in what he expects. Excellent readings. Helpful tutorials. Approachable, wise, understanding and clear. Would take every class he taught if I could.

I found his lectures interesting. But he was obviously an inexperienced prof. He didn't give TAs guideline for marking the assignment so TAs differed in how they marked. He was rude to some students in the online discussion forum&refused to reveal our participation marks even when he promised to do so. Marking schemes completely arbitrary& unfair.

This was his first semester teaching ever (anywhere), and he was easily the best prof I've ever had. Clear, interesting and not afraid of technology, his course was extremely well attended despite the fact that he posted lecture slides on the intranet for students to download. So that speaks volumes...
